ENGLISH: [ROOT.GetFullName],I too am a Defender of Middle-Earth, and you need aid! I am joining you in your defence against Evil!
Help in Defensive War against Evil.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] is currently loosing a defensive war against Evil. Now that you are peace, you can, as a Defender of Middle-Earth, join [Root.GetName] in [Root.GetHerHis] defensive war!
Must be loosing (-20% or worse) a defensive war against an Evil attacker.
Pay [Root.GetName] to come to your Court.
When inviting others to your court, those not of your species or culture are often reluctant to come. However, you can convince them with some cash.
The target to invite must be unmarried, not a coucillor, and must be otherwise have no importance.
You are 'Good Side' and the target to invite is not 'Evil Side'.
You are 'Evil Side' and the target to invite is not 'Good Side'.
You are neither 'Good Side' nor 'Evil Side'.
Recruit more active troops (archers and light infantry) for the Rangers of Ithilien.
Snagas are the lowest kind of orcs, lightly equipped slaves. You can get some cheaply.

#CODE: # Goverment Types and Laws and stuff

ENGLISH: The Kings and High Kings of the Elves, Dwarves, Dúnedian and some other Free Peoples were usually given a great deal of respect and obesiance, but at the same time were expected to be Just and stay within the accepted bounds of authority...
Vassals are a law unto themselves, ruling their fiefs like petty kingdoms. Their obligations to their liege are minimal.
FRENCH: Les vassaux n'obéissent qu'à leurs propres règles, dirigeant leurs propriétés comme de petits royaumes. Leurs obligations envers leur seigneur lige sont minimales.
GERMAN: Vasallen sind sich selbst das Gesetz und herrschen in ihren Lehen wie kleine Könige. Ihre Verpflichtungen gegenüber dem Lehnsherrn sind minmal.
SPANISH: Los vasallos tienen sus propias leyes y gobiernan sus feudos como si fueran pequeños reinos. Sus obligaciones hacia su señor son mínimas.

ENGLISH: Vassals enjoy a very large degree of autonomy, but have to provide their liege with a fairly substantial portion of the levies. Wars between vassals are forbidden.
FRENCH: Les vassaux ont une grande autonomie, mais ils doivent remettre à leur seigneur une importante part de leurs levées. Les guerres entre vassaux sont interdites.
GERMAN: Vasallen genießen weitgehende Autonomie, müssen aber einen nicht unwesentlichen Anteil der von ihnen eingenommenen Abgaben an den Lehnsherrn abgeben. Kriege zwischen Vasallen sind verboten.
SPANISH: Los vasallos gozan de bastante autonomía, pero tienen que proporcionar levas suficientes a su señor. Las guerras entre vasallos están prohibidas.

ENGLISH: The powers of vassals and the liege are in harmonious balance.
FRENCH: Il y a un équilibre harmonieux entre les pouvoirs des nobles et du monarque.
GERMAN: Die Macht des Adels und des Monarchen stehen in einem stets harmonisches Gleichgewicht
SPANISH: El poder de la nobleza y el del monarca están en un equilibrio armonioso.

ENGLISH: The liege Lord has curbed the rights of the powerful vassals, relying more on a bureaucracy led by people of lesser authority.
FRENCH: Le monarque limite les droits de la haute noblesse et se fie plutôt à une bureaucratie grandissante dirigée par une noblesse de second rang.
GERMAN: Der Monarch hat die Rechte des Hochadels beschnitten und stützt sich stattdessen auf eine neu entstehende, vom niederen Adel geführte Verwaltung.
SPANISH: El monarca ha reprimido los derechos de la alta nobleza y, en su lugar, confía en una burocracia incipiente dirigida por la baja nobleza.

ENGLISH: The vassals of the Realm are fearful of the unrestricted powers of the Liege, who can even revoke titles for no reason.
FRENCH: Les seigneurs du pays sont irrités devant le pouvoir sans limites du monarque absolu.
GERMAN: Die Adligen im Reich ächzen unter der uneingeschränkten Macht des Monarchen.
SPANISH: Los señores del reino están molestos con los poderes ilimitados del monarca absolutista.

ENGLISH: The ruler has acquired the right to freely seize the titles of those of different races, or cultures deemed too foreign.
